012package org.postgresql.pljava.example.polyglot;
013
014import java.sql.SQLException;
015
016import org.postgresql.pljava.PLJavaBasedLanguage.InlineBlocks;
017
018import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.SQLAction;
019
020import org.postgresql.pljava.model.ProceduralLanguage;
021
022/*
023 * The imports above are the basics to make this a language handler.
024 *
025 * These imports below for JDBC / database access might not be so common in a
026 * real language handler; you'd expect it to focus on compiling/executing some
027 * client code, and the client code is where you'd expect to see what looks
028 * more like application logic like this. But this is a handler for a very
029 * simple language that only takes the given string and hands it to JDBC, so it
030 * does look a bit like application logic.
031 */
032import java.sql.Connection;
033import static java.sql.DriverManager.getConnection;
034import java.sql.Statement;
035import org.postgresql.pljava.model.Portal;
036import static org.postgresql.pljava.model.Portal.ALL;
037import static org.postgresql.pljava.model.Portal.Direction.FORWARD;
038import org.postgresql.pljava.model.SlotTester; // temporary development hack
039
040import java.util.regex.Matcher;
041import java.util.regex.Pattern;
042
043/**
044 * Example of a procedural language with only DO blocks, built atop PL/Java.
045 */
046@SQLAction(requires = "pljavahandler language", install = {
047"CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION javatest.dosql_validator(oid)" +
048" RETURNS void" +
049" LANGUAGE pljavahandler AS 'org.postgresql.pljava.example.polyglot.DoSQL'",
050
051"COMMENT ON FUNCTION javatest.dosql_validator(oid) IS " +
052"'Validator function for the dosql procedural language'",
053
054"CREATE LANGUAGE dosql" +
055" HANDLER sqlj.pljavaDispatchRoutine" +
056" INLINE  sqlj.pljavaDispatchInline" +
057" VALIDATOR javatest.dosql_validator",
058
059"COMMENT ON LANGUAGE dosql IS " +
060"'The dosql procedural language, which is implemented atop PL/Java, " +
061"and supports inline code blocks that are just plain SQL, to be executed " +
062"with any output discarded. COMMIT and ROLLBACK are recognized " +
063"for transaction control.'",
064
065"DO LANGUAGE dosql 'SELECT javatest.logmessage(''INFO'', ''DoSQL ok'')'"
066}, remove = {
067"DROP LANGUAGE dosql",
068"DROP FUNCTION javatest.dosql_validator(oid)"
069})
070public class DoSQL implements InlineBlocks
071{
072    private final ProceduralLanguage pl;
073
074    /**
075     * There must be a public constructor with a {@code ProceduralLanguage}
076     * parameter.
077     *<p>
078     * The parameter can be ignored, or used to determine the name, oid,
079     * accessibility, or other details of the declared PostgreSQL language
080     * your handler class has been instantiated for.
081     */
082    public DoSQL(ProceduralLanguage pl)
083    {
084        this.pl = pl;
085    }
086
087    /**
088     * The sole method needed to implement inline code blocks.
089     *<p>
090     * This implementation will recognize {@code COMMIT} or {@code ROLLBACK}
091     * and call the dedicated JDBC {@code Connection} methods for those, or
092     * otherwise just pass the string to {@code Statement.execute} and consume
093     * and discard any results.
094     */
095    @Override
096    public void execute(String inlineSource, boolean atomic) throws SQLException
097    {
098        try (
099            Connection c = getConnection("jdbc:default:connection");
100            Statement s = c.createStatement()
101        )
102        {
103            Matcher m = COMMIT_OR_ROLLBACK.matcher(inlineSource);
104            if ( m.matches() )
105            {
106                if ( -1 != m.start(1) )
107                    c.commit();
108                else
109                    c.rollback();
110                return;
111            }
112
113            /*
114             * Not COMMIT or ROLLBACK, just hand it to execute() and consume
115             * any results.
116             */
117
118            SlotTester st = c.unwrap(SlotTester.class);
119            long count = 0;
120
121            for (
122                boolean isRS = s.execute(inlineSource);
123                -1 != count;
124                isRS = s.getMoreResults()
125            )
126            {
127                if ( isRS )
128                {
129                    try ( Portal p = st.unwrapAsPortal(s.getResultSet()) )
130                    {
131                        p.move(FORWARD, ALL);
132                    }
133                }
134                else
135                    count = s.getLargeUpdateCount();
136            }
137        }
138    }
139
140    static final Pattern COMMIT_OR_ROLLBACK =
141        Pattern.compile("^\\s*+(?i:(commit)|(rollback))\\s*+$");
142}
